body.p:
Headquarters 65th Ky. E. M.
Louis Ky. June 7" 1864
Thos. E Bramlitt.. Govr
Frankfort Ky

Dear Sir, There has occured a vacancy in the office of Lieutenant Colonel of the 65th Ky. Enrolled Malitia. by the former incumbent Joining the united states army. And accepting a position in the Quartermasters Department. We are ^now^ in the active Service and have no Lt Collonel I therefore recommend (George W Brown, as a suitable person to fill Said position whose appointment dates the 26th of May 1864 --
I have appointed Wiley W Howes, adjutant of the 65th and recommend that he be commisioned, to have date from 26" of May 1864
I have also appointed James Nibert Quartermaster and recommend that he be commisioned to have date the 31st of May, 1864.

I also recommend H. S. Sweatman to be commisioned as surgeon
of the 65th E. M. whose appointment date 26" of May 1864. all of the moniness are now in the active Service & performing the duties of their serveral offices.

I suppose the Quartermaster will have to Execute bond. If so send form of bond & amount to be Executed I have appointed a Paymaster, but and at a loss to know whether or not there is such an officer for the regiment being in the united States service for the present, inform me on the subject.s

On the 27" of February 1864 the malitia of Johnson Co. was organized under me as their Collonel and Captins and Lieutenants Elected for the various companies- and the certificates of their Elections wrote out and forwarded to you, but as yet there has been no commisions received- I would like to know, If they have been forwarded If not pleas forwarded them,
Any communication you may have for our regiment direct to care of the Post Commander at this place.

I am verry Respectfully yours
Respt yours
Burgess Preston Col.
65th Regt. Ky. E. M

65
Ky State Militia
Louisa Lawrence Co Ky
June 7, 1864
Preston Burgess Col. Comdg
65th E. M. Johnston Co

Recommends George W. Brown for Lieut Col vice -- who have joind the U. S. Service- Has appointed various Staff officers- wants to know if he is entitled to a P. M. and if his Q. M. will have to execute bond &c.

On the 27th February/64 he sent election returns but the officers elected have not yet recd their comms &c
Ans. June 21st 1864 on letter book Page 424. and coms & duplicate coms ordered & forwarded to the place & con requested
Rec. I. G. O. June 18. 1864
